intro: Senecio pinnatus var. rubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed African Daisy, is a striking member of the Asteraceae family native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and vibrant yellow ray florets surrounded by pale green disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a bushy, upright habit and a tendency to form compact clumps. Its stems are often reddish in color, giving it its common name, and it thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Senecio pinnatus var. rubescens is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant for its showy flowers and drought tolerance.
